Happy #valentinesweekend! #valentinesday2021 https://t.co/3Db8xqHOZs

If introduced, the Mexican #fruitfly #Anastrepha ludens is expected to establish in the most southern part of the European Union, possibly threatening citrus production. A new @EFSA_EU  #pest #survey card is now available: https://t.co/znHZxZwfB9 https://t.co/ORzfOqWPY1

Only 30% of female students select #STEM studies worldwide. Gender stereotypes can steer girls and women away from these fields, which is why role models play a pivotal part in increasing their passion for science. Who is your female scientist role model? ✍️👇
#WomenInScience https://t.co/OWS5HXi29v

Jennifer A. Doudna 👩🏼‍🔬, Emmanuelle Charpentier 👩🏽‍🔬, Frances H. Arnold👩🏽‍🔬 , Darleane C. Hoffman👩🏼‍🔬, or Katalin Karikó👩🏽‍🔬 - they are examples of  #WomenInScience that are remarkably contributing to chemistry and biochemistry.

Fill the space, science has no gender! 

#WomenInScienceDay https://t.co/SO9tHWehJb

Interesting presentation by Ernesto Liébana, European Food Safety Authority (@EFSA_EU), about how to move towards a holistic #AMR surveillance in food producing animals in Europe

#EUjamraiConf #KeepAntibioticsWorking https://t.co/FQnNDburhr

What are the new horizons for #FocalPoints? How can collaboration among #EUMemberStates be enhanced? Last discussion of the day, looking ahead to create a future fit-for-purpose FP design. https://t.co/LB9GQsZmuO

On the International Day of Girls and #WomenInScience let us introduce you to Marta Hugas, Chief Scientist at @EFSA_EU 👩🏻‍🔬

She is specialized in food safety especially in food hygiene and has worked for the @irtacat.

For more information click here:➡️https://t.co/7IBbvMcAgy https://t.co/kfpkCXpQHk
What is the percentage of female scientists and engineers in Europe?
What is the worldwide percentage of women in research and experimental development (R&D)?
Women and girls represent half of the world’s population, nevertheless when it comes to #STEM jobs gender gap is yet to close. Take part in our quiz and find out more! #WomenInScience #IDWGS

In 2020 women’s contribution to the fight against #COVID19 has been vital, yet the pandemic has had an overall negative impact on women scientists, widening the gender gap in science. Today we stress again the importance of #GenderEquality in #STEM jobs, happy #WomenInScience day https://t.co/3KZF1uOCPe

🧵4/5  Our advice will support @EU_Commission implement the #EUFarm2Fork Strategy, to submit, by end 2022, a proposal for harmonised mandatory #frontofpack nutrition labelling and for setting nutrient profiles to restrict promotion of certain foods.
